benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/accounts/{accountId}/cbaRebalancing - Rebalance account CBA

covered: PUT: Valid Request — Multiple success scenarios returning 204 with various CBA states and header combinations (TC01–TC07).
PUT: Non-Existing Resource — Invalid/unknown accountId returns 400 (TC08, TC09, TC16, TC17).
PUT: Concurrency Issues — High concurrency handled with consistent results (TC18).
Headers: Required header validation — Missing/empty/whitespace/null X-Killbill-CreatedBy -> 400 (TC10, TC11, TC25, TC26).
Headers: Optional headers handled — Reason/Comment provided and accepted (TC02); extra/unsupported headers ignored (TC12); unexpected query params tolerated (TC23).
Robustness: Network transient retry handled at client level (TC13).
Security hardening: Malicious inputs in headers (SQLi/XSS) are handled without info leakage (TC15, TC24).
gaps: PUT guideline: Idempotency not explicitly verified (repeat the same PUT and ensure CBA/result and response remain unchanged).
Story detail: "Produces: application/json" not validated (e.g., Content-Type header), and 204 responses should have an empty body — not asserted.
Authorization: No scenarios for missing/invalid auth token (401/403).
Validation: No positive test asserting a correctly formatted UUID is accepted when borderline cases (uppercase/lowercase, hyphen placement) are used.
Observability/Audit: No check that CreatedBy/Reason/Comment are recorded/audited (if required by system behavior).
recommendations: Add an idempotency scenario: call the same PUT twice on the same account and verify both 204 responses and identical CBA state/audit entries.
Assert response headers and body for 204: Content-Type (if advertised as application/json) and confirm empty body.
Add authorization negative tests: missing/expired/insufficient permissions token -> 401/403.
Expand UUID validation: include valid edge-case UUIDs (uppercase hex, variant/version compliance) and confirm acceptance.
If applicable, verify audit trail reflects X-Killbill-CreatedBy/Reason/Comment for the rebalance action.
